channel.title: MUKLA: MQL4 package manager for MetaTrader 4.
channel.description: Recent content on MUKLA: MQL4 package manager for MetaTrader 4.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation Install Hugo Hugo itself is just a single binary without dependencies on expensive runtimes like Ruby, Python or PHP and without dependencies on any databases. Note Currently, this theme makes use of features that will be part of the Hugo v0.16 release. You have to compile the latest developement version yourself. Let’s make sure Hugo is set up as expected. You should see a similar version number in your terminal:

item.title: Adding content
item.description: Hello world Let’s create our first content file for your documentation. Open a terminal and add the following command for each new file you want to add. Replace <section-name> with a general term that describes your document in detail. hugo new <section-name>/filename.md Visitors of your website will find the final document under www.example.com/<section-name>/filename/. Since it’s possible to have multiple content files in the same section I recommend to create at least one index.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: Quo vadis? The port of the original Alabaster theme has replicated nearly all of its features. A few are still missing, but I’ve good news: the Hugo community is actively working on this issues. Maybe with the next release of Hugo we can abandon this list. Stay tuned. Planned features Localization Currently, it is possible to collect all strings in a single place for easy customization. However, this only enables you to define all strings in a single language.

item.title: Foreword
item.description: What is Alabaster? Alabaster was originally a theme for the popular documentation tool Sphinx. This theme port to Hugo theme is all about documentations. It should allow you to easily create a documentation for your projects. Fabric and Invoke are two examples of the Alabaster theme in the wild. The following pages will guide you through the setup, introduce you to the very basics of Hugo and show you the capabilities of this theme.
